definitions.text: the consequences of an event (especially a catastrophic event)
examples: in the wake of the accident no one knew how many had been injured

definitions.text: an island in the western Pacific between Guam and Hawaii
the wave that spreads behind a boat as it moves forward
examples: the motorboat's wake capsized the canoe

definitions.text: a vigil held over a corpse the night before burial
examples: there's no weeping at an Irish wake

definitions.text: be awake, be alert, be there

examples: She woke up to the sound of the alarm clock

definitions.text: arouse or excite feelings and passions
examples: The ostentatious way of living of the rich ignites the hatred of the poor
The refugees' fate stirred up compassion around the world
His words woke us to terrible facts of the situation

definitions.text: cause to become awake or conscious
examples: He was roused by the drunken men in the street
